intro: Noccaea haussknechtii, commonly known as the Haussknecht's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the rocky and alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in shallow soil, often on limestone or other calcareous substrates. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces small, round, hairy seeds. Noccaea haussknechtii is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is often found in mountainous areas with limited soil depth.
